intro: Fernandezia putumayoensis, commonly known as the Putumayo fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
